cms.contentitemcommondata.BasicItemShortDescription: Developers want to know precisely what code they have deployed to their environment because this helps with testing and QA. Let's learn how to easily customize the System application in Xperience by Kentico's administration UI to include Git and .NET build metadata.
cms.contentitemcommondata.BasicItemTitle: Extending Xperience by Kentico Administration UI Pages #2 - Enhanced System Overview
cms.contentitemcommondata.ContentItemCommonDataVisualBuilderWidget:
{"editableAreas":[{"identifier":"main","sections":[{"identifier":"80e2f9ce-c976-4305-9a32-2328030dcf10","type":"CommunityPortal.SingleColumnSection","properties":{"layout":"Standard","layoutParsed":0,"paddingTop":"Large","paddingTopParsed":0,"paddingBottom":"Large","paddingBottomParsed":0,"backgroundColor":"White","backgroundColorParsed":1},"zones":[{"identifier":"fb3da060-16a8-4b98-83b0-5b240619d7b7","widgets":[{"identifier":"e8f7803b-9ff6-42f7-bca5-101dbee2a15c","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"8438afce-5d54-46e1-87ed-842832712f1a","properties":{"markdown":"This post was written for [Xperience by Kentico v29.0.0](https://docs.kentico.com/changelog#refresh-april-18-2024). Please [consult the documentation](https://docs.kentico.com/changelog) for any feature or API changes when using a different version. Be sure to check the [System Requirements](https://docs.kentico.com/x/DgKQC) in the product documentation.
","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"0aa46dbb-95b1-4e25-9a63-f875378e786d"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"919ffff9-7f5b-452d-9871-fedd02d835b4","markdownStyle":"22840c3c-28b0-4911-8f21-31ca8c845f21","markdownStyleParsed":"30a10468-793c-494e-9088-352fa2de4bea","markdownCodeLanguage":"85b734e4-e3c0-414b-a1d1-b7336bde604d","id":"569c78eb-b3bd-46fe-91e9-510d446bfdfc"}}]},{"identifier":"60f6dbab-5153-4bf4-b202-2dab1bb07e9d","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"b610f14e-61e7-4aa2-b6c7-5e8f811e593f","properties":{"markdown":"To continue the previous blog post in this series - [Extending Xperience by Kentico Administration UI Pages](https://community.kentico.com/blog/extending-xperience-by-kentico-administration-ui-pages) - we'll be looking at another helpful way to extend the Xperience administration UI, this time to assist developers tracking deployments in multiple environments.

If you use a modern approach to application development, with [continuous integration and deployments](https://docs.kentico.com/x/YAaiCQ), you likely have dev ops tooling that tells you what version of your application is in each environment (ex: Development, QA, Production). This information is helpful when you are working with stakeholders to validate which bugs 🐜 have been resolved, which resolutions still need testing, which features are available, and which lines of code from source control are actually executing.

Wouldn't it be nice if this information was also available in the Xperience by Kentico administration dashboard? This would help stakeholders quickly see the "version" of their Xperience solution that was deployed and developers could also see the commit hash without having to jump back into the dev ops tools 🙌🏽.

I'm going to spoil the surprise 😅 with a screenshot, showing we can do this by extending the System application's `SystemOverview` page and adding some metadata from our .NET build to the screen.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"0371d211-b5a4-4fea-9d14-7b942351057d"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"f53dde2e-f6fa-445d-b5b5-02dd64c12bed","markdownStyle":"6226b1ee-6727-4b01-9707-ff0c00d2d44a","markdownStyleParsed":"dcbdff32-54f4-4712-baaf-1477a8709a1a","markdownCodeLanguage":"cd097f30-fff2-4d7d-a3bc-7452632cb524","id":"98070a81-1920-46b6-94cc-53e40fb9d970"}}]},{"identifier":"ceaa9055-c3de-4c5e-b442-cd88e4c32ff3","type":"CommunityPortal.ImageWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"d693ee00-980b-4405-8a5b-126518ea5b45","properties":{"selectedImages":[{"identifier":"b8b0dadd-e2cb-4b03-ad35-451dafeec671"}],"alignment":"Center","alignmentParsed":1,"size":"Full_Width","sizeParsed":3,"showDescriptionAsCaption":false,"linkToFullsizeImage":true,"id":"cc5fd7f8-8588-47b4-8f38-8574ac7604d9"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"selectedImages":"786e1631-b46d-47d5-bf6e-9f5f7ff74470","alignment":"0450684e-3ec8-45a1-96db-587e62a74ecd","alignmentParsed":"0e7a156b-c2fd-4da2-a956-97d6f96b0191","size":"c95d09c6-024b-4aaf-a75d-df2d175d8726","sizeParsed":"bacc758c-409a-4450-914d-82994ce199f6","showDescriptionAsCaption":"9f3a3afa-c3f7-4179-841e-d9a1acee5c95","linkToFullsizeImage":"73ccea72-1b80-471d-b284-cf930fe8ed78","id":"ede74d6e-61bd-49b9-81ec-e1985c9f8833"}}]},{"identifier":"3ad4d19c-474f-48c3-81d7-6775b1bc71bb","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"52713f12-71ed-448b-95da-87d200f4fe0e","properties":{"markdown":"In the image above the "Application assembly version" is the version of our ASP.NET Core application assembly and the Git hash is... well, the hash in Git of the code currently running the Xperience by Kentico application.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"1ae4a215-39bb-4b88-92cd-4553ddbbabf7"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"ea657161-9196-4f7c-b4db-597eb103675e","markdownStyle":"05fa465d-b1af-4c89-aaa6-503d0b3fada9","markdownStyleParsed":"6d452190-65cb-4a58-816a-923bdf56ff27","markdownCodeLanguage":"e416f3f2-cbed-44f6-9fe4-df7a8eb90c3a","id":"e3006810-8463-4568-8a9a-4bc1b25266a9"}}]},{"identifier":"e042083b-9bb7-4fe6-a91c-5388bab53c78","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"06cc611e-ced1-4884-9625-343db8b14578","properties":{"headingText":"Finding the UI Page","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"5db30290-dc44-49be-a50d-35ca1bf0aa60"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"55616e75-cf61-49d0-892e-3a6471422f6a","headingLevel":"20599c46-3e4c-4392-b62a-c20cb18a1d23","headingLevelsParsed":"b7b66412-7f25-4eba-b8c0-a6e0914af644","headingAlignment":"82b9860d-fee7-4e07-a11a-50b9b4f87ec7","headingAlignmentsParsed":"eea7664b-d38a-4976-ba80-d79663f589ca","showHeadingAnchor":"5da016a0-93f3-41d6-ba53-1979dcda7041","id":"71ff1c08-83e4-4367-8190-91e22793b3cf"}}]},{"identifier":"2de6d227-cafa-44a1-af81-b25a68e5f02b","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"3c181d6f-a341-47da-a1b7-8e3cef24948e","properties":{"markdown":"My process for extending UI Pages in the Xperience administration involves a few steps.

1. Find the page in the UI that I want to extend by navigating to it in the Xperience administration
2. Find the C# class that represents the page
3. Decompile the page class in my IDE (using VS Code, ILSpy, ect...)
4. Explore the page's publicly accessible properties, implementation details, and also visually review the UI created by the page
5. Create a `PageExtender` class that customizes the page using what I learned about it from the steps above

Using that process, we first identify the page we want to customize in the Xperience administration. Here's where the System application is found in the Xperience dashboard.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"0203d467-dfa7-4031-a33a-aaafb0878bfe"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"c326deb9-b147-45a6-9b44-4007ddf85901","markdownStyle":"9854d766-4f7a-4bec-9db3-e5a3ae6600c0","markdownStyleParsed":"553a56ea-b3e3-4c95-9ead-c8f661ff7c01","markdownCodeLanguage":"0d761a8e-f7f8-477e-81b6-31f17adca50b","id":"2799706b-cb48-4614-af1e-11ed016b37f3"}}]},{"identifier":"7f3dbf4b-e7b5-4ef1-8c50-2b4517a0ca12","type":"CommunityPortal.ImageWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"863930f5-b972-402f-a2fb-3558c78426a0","properties":{"selectedImages":[{"identifier":"331e7cb5-3d96-4a2a-8390-ef000065258c"}],"alignment":"Center","alignmentParsed":1,"size":"Full_Width","sizeParsed":3,"showDescriptionAsCaption":false,"linkToFullsizeImage":true,"id":"b8d08a4d-d913-454e-8ba1-ab2eb8bc554c"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"selectedImages":"59965269-290f-46e0-9a2a-ada45882c9ce","alignment":"e7b3f347-7fbe-431a-a25d-0892080513ed","alignmentParsed":"9ac90faa-5f92-4269-96a7-626e5bab1145","size":"f0ac63cd-b7c3-478a-87a6-1192235640b5","sizeParsed":"ec9e4b49-4e40-4683-8f67-b2129bb34314","showDescriptionAsCaption":"a20a248c-ca0d-4f70-8d61-f7c5ff6fbd4d","linkToFullsizeImage":"5087433c-14b0-4521-ad76-c21a2460d751","id":"74e6dece-0bab-4287-b807-b2b3e6028ede"}}]},{"identifier":"1df98bbf-7c95-43a0-a854-3b43b1a1b076","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"8341c114-5a3d-4432-be30-cccd8703bc1e","properties":{"markdown":"We know the page is likely the "system" page or related to it. All UI Pages in the Xperience administration can be found in the `Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.UIPages` namespace, so I'll type that namespace in my editor like I'm using it access a type and use intellisense to find the right page by naming convention 😉.

There are 2 types that have `System` in their name in this namespaces - `SystemApplication` and `SystemOverview`. "Application" pages in Xperience are usually container pages that have sub pages - they create a "visual" namespace and help create more complex UIs.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"7a4c89a5-982e-4c92-8b3b-6369355d4d7b"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"386192f1-481a-4406-8ae3-9ddef4b842fc","markdownStyle":"3faa09a0-a8e9-40b3-b2e9-4d620b400501","markdownStyleParsed":"561ab9f5-7866-482c-92da-950877fbfebc","markdownCodeLanguage":"40092b13-c49b-4bd8-ba91-5d92b6651ae0","id":"794f2f11-e157-4be9-a75a-c827c983f48c"}}]},{"identifier":"22083cd8-09cd-4a14-9f08-70c519fe31e6","type":"CommunityPortal.ImageWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"5f1f592f-4617-4584-8033-ce78e0a58cb7","properties":{"selectedImages":[{"identifier":"d943f03d-9c78-4532-8bf8-be7c913f02b2"}],"alignment":"Center","alignmentParsed":1,"size":"Full_Width","sizeParsed":3,"showDescriptionAsCaption":false,"linkToFullsizeImage":true,"id":"59b1eba9-f741-4cae-bcc9-2773c55719a9"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"selectedImages":"27ac20f5-1415-457b-8c9d-70deb2adb5bc","alignment":"fa550824-7966-4a37-81fa-ae1140772e2b","alignmentParsed":"e5d05189-289a-4983-b436-a8e0d54b43a4","size":"1a66f270-7261-4e3f-babd-1d828b059442","sizeParsed":"46720e32-4e20-4945-876b-cf16d85fee9c","showDescriptionAsCaption":"6e56e562-fe1e-4b04-9d2e-6aceb0dd8dab","linkToFullsizeImage":"525f0492-00ba-49c8-a922-783a6a892ae8","id":"5f36bf12-eb8d-44ba-aa03-fc145ec02b76"}}]},{"identifier":"9aba0192-1064-4683-b8b0-c7132175eb86","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"2049bfcb-b8b2-4b88-9b6e-671d77d02fe0","properties":{"markdown":"If we view the UI of the page displayed when we navigate to the System application from the dashboard we can see the breadcrumbs show we are redirected to the "Overview" page. Additionally, the URL ends in `system-overview`. This all tells me the `SystemOverview` type is the UI Page we want to extend 👍🏼.

We can also confirm this by decompiling the type and there are at least two easy ways to confirm this in VS Code.

The first, using [the C# DevKit VS Code extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-dotnettools.csdevkit), requires us to place our cursor on the `SystemOverview` type name, and press the F12 key which opens the decompiled class in a new editor tab.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"b3025499-9294-42f0-99ce-e9b5aed7c528"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"2a437988-cba7-4fcb-b5ef-1438692c6136","markdownStyle":"9c658616-e78d-4be7-80de-d400c7383838","markdownStyleParsed":"64e0cabb-5e45-4a3a-b849-27c5bce1748e","markdownCodeLanguage":"906c9e9b-dd04-4010-969b-2bdaf40ba824","id":"d2516514-4e8c-468c-bb7c-b4960d2869b3"}}]},{"identifier":"38d1367b-eada-4b97-99da-9884c14a1bbe","type":"CommunityPortal.ImageWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"c8e7db89-a534-415f-9355-3b8b1f6743b4","properties":{"selectedImages":[{"identifier":"bc458cdc-9cd0-44c9-ab81-a0eeee1efed8"}],"alignment":"Center","alignmentParsed":1,"size":"Full_Width","sizeParsed":3,"showDescriptionAsCaption":false,"linkToFullsizeImage":true,"id":"0dfb55df-33d3-49a9-bab0-4fceb59792df"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"selectedImages":"c7b81d75-45a2-4a33-9a86-e204c0dba1db","alignment":"2936c64f-8977-41df-9001-2e1dc41c291f","alignmentParsed":"9b781282-d053-43d1-b583-f4e45a911a3c","size":"8d0b3b09-4deb-4ff9-bf2a-4bde9698f1ff","sizeParsed":"f834dc46-2771-43e9-9045-3c6cbb386861","showDescriptionAsCaption":"e1ab5923-2c5c-4f09-af73-4871d8969a63","linkToFullsizeImage":"d76726f9-b28f-47f2-b659-d495960f9027","id":"4dcbc0a5-837c-4814-8586-f1988b86d796"}}]},{"identifier":"d436aabc-0ebe-40a7-b752-9ce6ee902ef7","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"6a6f6567-6e92-4a58-ba15-09ba03e10cd2","properties":{"markdown":"An alternative is to use the [VS Code ILSpy extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=icsharpcode.ilspy-vscode) to decompile the `Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.dll` assembly (accessible in your ASP.NET Core app's `\bin\Debug\net8.0\` folder) and navigate to the `Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.UIPages` namespace and the `SystemOverview` type.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"432a388f-045f-4cb6-bb75-287a49f7f085"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"faf9a40c-958e-4e95-a6d8-c2c536cf5a77","markdownStyle":"3b22aceb-1ebb-4c8f-ad29-a1e519fb77d1","markdownStyleParsed":"65ab337e-0c4a-4328-a35e-7b0a522119ae","markdownCodeLanguage":"f6c6eabd-2475-4a19-a3a8-7d25b1942a8c","id":"365f11a1-ebb3-42d8-b7cf-97ba26a7ad12"}}]},{"identifier":"85b9267b-a93d-4831-a73f-9a92b9bd8f71","type":"CommunityPortal.ImageWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"9f42ef7d-f5c3-4753-9958-aa5f1ca203b2","properties":{"selectedImages":[{"identifier":"e55e7a45-9779-4421-972f-aa9444e510d8"}],"alignment":"Center","alignmentParsed":1,"size":"Full_Width","sizeParsed":3,"showDescriptionAsCaption":false,"linkToFullsizeImage":true,"id":"a0923da7-f057-4aaf-a59f-d737a27576c2"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"selectedImages":"fff813c5-5e12-46c2-8e29-a5c5a02529d0","alignment":"158f35e8-4ad3-4bd5-bd91-a83ea26c9905","alignmentParsed":"eb7fab9d-8b8a-4b04-82bb-7aa31432ef5a","size":"520e57de-17bc-49c8-a272-4c634b0bf781","sizeParsed":"6e37a10c-33e5-479e-9cec-1df6b6d40a63","showDescriptionAsCaption":"c11e71e8-dd6d-4ad3-ab28-91dd4e2d4024","linkToFullsizeImage":"9bc71c6f-a09d-4963-b028-a9dc44464a3d","id":"3d4194d6-703a-4638-aebe-1b2b8140a5e4"}}]},{"identifier":"ac9260fd-b672-4055-89c0-97a958de5df9","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"e7f56b9e-850a-4cee-8829-bcff717009fc","properties":{"markdown":"The first option is quicker and more precise, but requires you know the type you are looking for already. The second option requires a few more steps but is great for exploration 🗺.
","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"055ee5f1-0330-484e-b2b9-4bdff3fd983e"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"ad304093-219f-4523-bf3d-14375832f632","markdownStyle":"6883fd9e-40b4-4a17-9945-40d1639d2250","markdownStyleParsed":"5bd41e15-afb0-4a7d-93da-4196255070a0","markdownCodeLanguage":"1941bf18-2187-445e-a7b7-8fa66f5d39ec","id":"a84843aa-0531-43fe-8647-30923cc771c3"}}]},{"identifier":"112cfcd9-eaf1-4137-9e11-714a13ff5408","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"708284a2-a4d3-4541-a107-ff6425ce0a37","properties":{"markdown":"In either case, we will see a `ConfigurePage` method. This is where UI Pages perform most of their setup. In the `SystemOverview` class' `ConfigurePage` method, 2 "Card Groups" and 3 "Cards" are added to the page configuration with the cards being "System", "Database", and "Memory Statistics". This matches up with the layout of the UI, so we're on the right track 😎.

Before we dig into extending the page, we want to decide how we'll access the deployment and build information we want to display. Fortunately, .NET does a lot of this for us!
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"94c7c5e7-e00a-4e8e-b803-8a210b0ec4f9"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"16a5ec58-c63c-4b15-89df-3d934d0b55aa","markdownStyle":"dce33789-5a18-48de-8cda-6493491270d5","markdownStyleParsed":"0b0044ff-759a-4717-9b51-99aea6dca731","markdownCodeLanguage":"54f95ef0-3aa9-4fcf-b927-0a1909d7d1f4","id":"c38277d9-b8b3-4447-a33b-135109491166"}}]},{"identifier":"ccb84c4d-4e20-4be8-b8a6-d21365cc4f37","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"f5fee2bb-c53c-4e8d-b6f1-03c12176e769","properties":{"headingText":".NET SDK and Source Link","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"b1aac918-9c43-45a4-a074-033470cd63a6"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"43137c4d-59b3-42a2-8c79-984371b55904","headingLevel":"e0b76d56-980f-440b-bfc2-633286d3ce4d","headingLevelsParsed":"729ad3dc-5873-448b-a078-dd9719772c6a","headingAlignment":"46b153f8-cda3-4bca-90e2-c228430a2994","headingAlignmentsParsed":"4d748454-f042-4158-915b-4887672ad486","showHeadingAnchor":"2c22d9f5-8a18-4dd9-a819-b23419f5f79c","id":"1e7672d4-b931-4f1b-9b3a-01eec3140770"}}]},{"identifier":"d790a603-2027-4801-aace-cd456dd97891","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"d9d24bc8-8b14-4d37-b01d-3564a8b2d8fd","properties":{"markdown":"[Source Link](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/library-guidance/sourcelink) is a technology that embeds Git information in .NET assemblies and symbol files (`.pdb`) so that developers can debug into compiled libraries. If you haven't used it yet, definitely spend some time exploring it and configuring your IDE to use it.

In .NET 8 [Source Link was turned on by default](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/compatibility/sdk/8.0/source-link) which means if you are using the [.NET 8 SDK](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/8.0) to build your Xperience by Kentico solutions, your Git commit hash is *already* embedded in the assembly metadata.

The question is ... where 🤔?

Well, if we use the [ILSpy VS Code extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=icsharpcode.ilspy-vscode) and decompile our own assembly built in the .NET 8 SDK (right click on a `.dll` file in the VS Code Explorer and select "Decompile selected assembly), we can see the root level assembly information as a bunch of assembly attributes.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"e24fb18b-e71c-4f64-a966-ab1151d076bd"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"01868dc7-df22-4c66-b5c6-0613a28b077e","markdownStyle":"9267ad75-7893-4aac-b112-6bdb9b641c22","markdownStyleParsed":"cb216900-c8ad-4dc7-87da-91987a75da83","markdownCodeLanguage":"4b375a20-aa29-4a40-ae0f-a2e988b23832","id":"e54039a2-da1f-4103-9b7e-cb98f435d531"}}]},{"identifier":"3e7184ce-880c-4725-9b75-aaf35c6328f0","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"d6739467-a680-4fe4-9727-22ba53362b64","properties":{"markdown":"This example uses the [Kentico.Community.Portal.Core](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/tree/v29.0.3.4/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Core) assembly.
","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"39753ac0-daa4-4e6c-af92-41631a1449fd"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"bdfbbbaa-e330-4efb-b8fa-fee6ed2f2059","markdownStyle":"b2bcc91b-013a-4c75-be42-21ac2e6b3266","markdownStyleParsed":"e1c9d9c3-804b-4af9-9368-111736b05610","markdownCodeLanguage":"ce59040a-f8d3-4058-9855-222670c066a9","id":"5333bf9f-f835-4b28-80a9-4435229e3c1f"}}]},{"identifier":"7e2997fe-bea1-4a2c-8d2e-2f98089e2c41","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"4a4f7528-89ec-427d-b40f-af5d2fc6ba5b","properties":{"markdown":"```CSharp
// Kentico.Community.Portal.Core, Version=29.0.3.2, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null

// ... 

[assembly: TargetFramework(".NETCoreApp,Version=v8.0", FrameworkDisplayName = ".NET 8.0")]
[assembly: AssemblyDiscoverable]
[assembly: AssemblyCompany("Kentico.Community.Portal.Core")]
[assembly: AssemblyConfiguration("Debug")]
[assembly: AssemblyFileVersion("29.0.3.2")]
[assembly: AssemblyInformationalVersion("29.0.3.2+b3c1e7f8d97db90027cd8d2fb4e7be758fec38bf")]
[assembly: AssemblyProduct("Kentico.Community.Portal.Core")]
[assembly: AssemblyTitle("Kentico.Community.Portal.Core")]
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("29.0.3.2")]

// ...
```

Notice the `AssemblyInformationalVersion` attribute has the `AssemblyFileVersion` followed by a `+` and what appears to be a Git hash (because it *is* a Git hash)!

We just need to use .NET reflection to access that attribute's value at runtime, parse the value into 2 segments, and then display it in the administration UI with our `PageExtender`.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"1aa76519-90d2-4a2e-9dcc-d77b8378a0af"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"bbfc28ab-25da-4506-9f1b-6b620b321395","markdownStyle":"30aee1b2-34ad-4f0e-86ea-40676eb087be","markdownStyleParsed":"2325fb8b-1604-4faa-a1ed-cf40002579a0","markdownCodeLanguage":"ba3c5000-1ae5-45ea-8145-171e61b33786","id":"b212f2ac-b2d3-4e03-b611-422cab25e55b"}}]},{"identifier":"4810176b-d955-4143-92a7-991b59987304","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"2ab28359-375f-44c3-bcca-4a72bd9e27da","properties":{"headingText":"Parsing the AssemblyInformationalVersion","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"41c19a80-51d4-475b-819e-82398a39aa71"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"d8aea286-17a5-4234-89ae-930e126fb0d6","headingLevel":"ea57be64-5e81-4457-afba-f53eb974c127","headingLevelsParsed":"2ef40eb8-c980-4032-90dd-cdc84d37b0c4","headingAlignment":"5f3f634a-d100-4ca0-a9f3-72c2faf5ecf4","headingAlignmentsParsed":"198d5d04-911f-4375-89b7-71c57158de28","showHeadingAnchor":"f447e5a8-b296-4488-a7c0-c4c6cd246f62","id":"18151524-5061-4470-b7e9-59b890466da3"}}]},{"identifier":"48e696de-0e17-4ff2-9feb-ba1bfec503b0","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"3717557e-df85-40fc-8a2c-45db23a1cefc","properties":{"markdown":"Thankfully, someone has already done the hard work here - the world renown 🏆 Scott Hanselman [solved the problem several years ago](https://www.hanselman.com/blog/adding-a-git-commit-hash-and-azure-devops-build-number-and-build-id-to-an-aspnet-website).

I've simplified his solution below.

```CSharp
/// <summary>
/// Exposes the current entry assembly's version and git hash information
/// </summary>
/// <remarks>
/// See https://www.hanselman.com/blog/adding-a-git-commit-hash-and-azure-devops-build-number-and-build-id-to-an-aspnet-website
/// </remarks>
public class ApplicationAssemblyInformation
{
 public ApplicationAssemblyInformation()
 {
 // Dummy version for local dev
 string versionAndHash = "1.0.0+NO_COMMIT";

 string infoVersion = Assembly.GetEntryAssembly()
 ?.GetCustomAttributes<AssemblyInformationalVersionAttribute>()
 .Select(a => a.InformationalVersion)
 .FirstOrDefault() ?? "";

 if (0 < infoVersion.IndexOf('+') && infoVersion.IndexOf('+') <= infoVersion.Length)
 {
 // Hash is embedded in the version after a '+' symbol, e.g. 1.0.0+a34a913742f8845d3da5309b7b17242222d41a21
 versionAndHash = infoVersion;
 }

 Version = versionAndHash[..versionAndHash.IndexOf('+')];
 GitHash = versionAndHash[(versionAndHash.IndexOf('+') + 1)..];
 }

 /// <summary>
 /// The git hash of the code that the application's Entry Assembly was generated from
 /// </summary>
 public string GitHash { get; }
 /// <summary>
 /// The version of the application's Entry Assembly
 /// </summary>
 public string Version { get; }
}
```

<br />
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"bfa8a0be-ee67-439f-ac44-da5e96c4fdca"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"2d7c75a4-f6bc-49fe-8e40-535aae42e9d8","markdownStyle":"880ddef8-709f-4e77-ae27-a960bae347c5","markdownStyleParsed":"33c56476-ad2d-42dd-9b6a-0082bb9b4deb","markdownCodeLanguage":"e4e31fa0-6659-44a6-ab75-aea8d808fbba","id":"c0e267bd-7561-4376-89b2-5a3a122a43d6"}}]},{"identifier":"e4bc7b86-555b-4134-834f-e80a031002bd","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"d551485e-e667-499b-8c36-5606bc4c4e61","properties":{"markdown":"We can either "new" up an `ApplicationAssemblyInformation` instance every time we need it, make it a `static` class, or add it as a singleton to our DI container (which is the approach I choose here).

```CSharp
services.AddSingleton(s => new ApplicationAssemblyInformation())
```

Now, let's get back to creating our `PageExtender`.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"dea6dd25-dc33-42b9-b7e1-f09059443db0"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"72e3da15-a3f7-4a9a-a0d9-96ffbd1b331c","markdownStyle":"59a305b5-d547-4ffe-9657-73763b0f56fc","markdownStyleParsed":"f7fcbb8d-43c6-4915-992b-06326ecb6c74","markdownCodeLanguage":"4059e7ff-9d6c-43c5-9ab5-208e939ea49e","id":"08a8eefa-d76d-464c-9dce-8c229f64d381"}}]},{"identifier":"2dee5496-3b10-4ce7-bb34-4d151fbf91ce","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"70e6d419-cea2-40d9-9696-a229aca02a3c","properties":{"headingText":"The System Overview Extender","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"a81cea59-62b0-4c08-981c-8be7d940980f"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"72eb1b89-03cb-43aa-9417-8ca43f6abee0","headingLevel":"b968731f-765b-47f4-8cb1-19d4de90ef3b","headingLevelsParsed":"6b263420-7930-4b46-b2c2-424279deec03","headingAlignment":"aa2378fa-61e7-4bf5-bfe6-e4d3be7b206f","headingAlignmentsParsed":"44c43495-1366-4961-8817-8bcf2b92d61d","showHeadingAnchor":"ef1dc48e-5f2d-4941-b952-cf04c63160e9","id":"7f603f30-01d6-4945-a01f-e84198324dce"}}]},{"identifier":"bd3f9ff2-ba3e-424e-b61d-670d1d6a224d","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"684f0a12-1f74-4fb7-94f6-2a037a7dcb9a","properties":{"markdown":"First, we'll create a new `SystemOverviewExtender.cs` file and C# class.

```CSharp
using DancingGoat.Admin.UIPages;
using Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base;
using Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.Forms;
using Kentico.Xperience.Admin.Base.UIPages;

[assembly: PageExtender(typeof(SystemOverviewExtender))]

namespace DancingGoat.Admin.UIPages;

public class SystemOverviewExtender(
 ApplicationAssemblyInformation assemblyInformation)
 : PageExtender<SystemOverview>
{
 private readonly ApplicationAssemblyInformation assemblyInformation = assemblyInformation;

 public override async Task ConfigurePage()
 {
 await base.ConfigurePage();

 // add customizations here
 }
}
```

We inject the `ApplicationAssemblyInformation` into the constructor and override the `ConfigurePage` method.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"c8e61051-28a7-42c3-8961-6fbb6ab6d647"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"176cfdf1-611e-47ed-b971-97437f2060f8","markdownStyle":"69fdc0c8-d2f9-470e-ade7-7196038774cf","markdownStyleParsed":"c538994c-c0cb-4fa2-ab92-b5cb50a48dbc","markdownCodeLanguage":"472001b5-cf52-4275-8218-01a3a50bfcf4","id":"80726488-6b36-4a1e-b472-186b555bbbe2"}}]},{"identifier":"dc502223-3fd2-43db-8433-d881871b0435","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"efc9071d-ea02-4153-bbf1-6fce14cfa226","properties":{"markdown":"It's **extremely** important to `await` the `base.ConfigurePage()` method. The base class *might* not do any async work in `ConfigurePage`, but if it does and we don't `await` it, we will likely introduce a difficult to debug race condition since the page won't be completely "setup" by the time we start customizing it.
","markdownStyle":"Note","markdownStyleParsed":1,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"ca550923-1093-4103-b910-1eb9b5da3878"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"78ea5d2f-c400-4b21-931f-6ee9318bcc06","markdownStyle":"6ee62fde-9a8f-4e77-b242-1638c4a1727e","markdownStyleParsed":"e4a16c7a-e23a-4b1a-9fb5-365364e6a931","markdownCodeLanguage":"3b131a80-1471-4aa6-a35b-2b16bb16d702","id":"532661e1-8d4d-424e-8d55-bbc8fac7dc73"}}]},{"identifier":"74f1bd44-a45d-4f2e-bda0-936098aaec6f","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"374aefa4-1fd4-4c91-88b9-4f1530520ed3","properties":{"markdown":"If we look back at the decompiled `SystemOverview` class, we can see the first card of the first card group is the "System Information" card.

```CSharp
base.PageConfiguration
 .CardGroups
 .AddCardGroup()
 .AddCard(GetSystemInformationCard());
```

This card has a list of components, each of which is a label/value line modeled as a `TextWithLabelClientProperties`.

```CSharp
overviewCard.Components = new List<IOverviewCardComponent>
{
 new FormCardComponent
 {
 Items = new TextWithLabelClientProperties[3]
 {
 CreateFormItem("label"), value)),
 // ...
 }
 }
};
```

We'll add 2 more `TextWithLabelClientProperties` to the `Items` list with our own labels and values

```CSharp
var component = Page.PageConfiguration
 .CardGroups.FirstOrDefault()?
 .Cards.FirstOrDefault()?
 .Components.FirstOrDefault();

if (component is not FormCardComponent cardComponent)
{
 return;
}

cardComponent.Items.Add(CreateFormItem(
 "Application assembly version", assemblyInformation.Version));
cardComponent.Items.Add(CreateFormItem(
 "Git hash", assemblyInformation.GitHash));
```

I've re-created the `private CreateFormItem` method from the original `SystemOverview` class so I can use it in the extender class.

```CSharp
private static TextWithLabelClientProperties CreateFormItem(string headline, string text) =>
 new()
 {
 Name = headline,
 Label = headline,
 Value = text,
 ComponentName = "@kentico/xperience-admin-base/TextWithLabel"
 };
```

And that's it 👏🏻... we just need to run our ASP.NET Core Xperience project and navigate to the the System application from the administration dashboard to see our build data.
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"1aea9c66-cc83-4a6b-8be9-f1dfe8013421"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"cea85350-7432-41cb-9de4-4cde8d68ae73","markdownStyle":"7dd49fd0-f7d6-49d9-bc95-df45cad6bcb9","markdownStyleParsed":"910dabd0-5889-4c01-bba5-c8f168f92526","markdownCodeLanguage":"2438d8d4-6ad9-49c8-a598-4185340b4051","id":"4d0161ec-4831-40db-843c-30dd912dd447"}}]},{"identifier":"f570f323-11f8-4978-bd08-e035a59b6f76","type":"CommunityPortal.HeadingWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"22c6c3d9-de76-4822-b4fe-a6347aea617c","properties":{"headingText":"Wrap up","headingLevel":"H2","headingLevelsParsed":1,"headingAlignment":"Left","headingAlignmentsParsed":0,"showHeadingAnchor":true,"id":"a081e441-108d-4570-a5d5-b8cae2577385"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"headingText":"4d65f526-6353-44ed-b36a-262f72320db9","headingLevel":"583e8128-ec38-4f66-8467-c5a35987e8a5","headingLevelsParsed":"f7af2d36-bca1-4473-8592-299436c08f25","headingAlignment":"017610dc-040a-4f59-a56a-1917393f9c1d","headingAlignmentsParsed":"ef092c88-8c71-4b3f-967f-34d530cb275b","showHeadingAnchor":"3d548c72-0405-48c2-ba11-2e4026ccf5b0","id":"ad86a6b6-dcac-4301-8597-829d39549db6"}}]},{"identifier":"6fcd0c9d-95e8-47a3-a794-70b436ff6c0f","type":"CommunityPortal.MarkdownWidget","variants":[{"identifier":"49ab084d-3b53-4c49-8585-27f7f9d80f92","properties":{"markdown":"We used the `PageExtender` to customize the System Overview page of Xperience's administration UI, adding information from our application build. This helps us know precisely what code is deployed to a specific environment. If you want to see how this is being used in the Kentico Community Portal, check out [the source code on GitHub](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.0.3.4/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/UIPages/SystemOverviewExtender.cs).
","markdownStyle":"Standard","markdownStyleParsed":0,"markdownCodeLanguage":"","id":"61effea9-eca7-4ea7-9e64-d0ea188a6520"},"fieldIdentifiers":{"markdown":"b5aadf00-2df2-43f3-9eec-5c66870a8f65","markdownStyle":"d7fd4366-f32a-44ae-9c75-4ae46de97a22","markdownStyleParsed":"3343459e-7dfd-4bed-87db-6d81879a3e17","markdownCodeLanguage":"66b189d0-a90e-4504-8712-f399c3e477d2","id":"53b69ce6-c0fa-408d-aad6-cb18c23e4c6c"}}]}]}],"fieldIdentifiers":{"layout":"4cbf875c-3f95-4031-99fb-d06edf41a448","layoutParsed":"7c870bc6-b2ce-4c5f-b034-c3524c4f3401","paddingTop":"45d6e469-05bd-4786-8acc-984b31362a91","paddingTopParsed":"d2feded5-259a-4cbf-aff9-98fc85ae19cf","paddingBottom":"d661b629-9583-4baf-9bb1-b92431eb007e","paddingBottomParsed":"90134ee2-a60c-4bdf-8d54-fe8c72369b3d","backgroundColor":"345fd155-d56a-4649-a82b-7b58193bec86","backgroundColorParsed":"94d4bd98-76f7-4285-aff5-8bbc1fc00054"}}]}]}
cms.contentitemcommondata.WebPageMetaShortDescription: Developers want to know precisely what code they have deployed to their environment because this helps with testing and QA. Let's learn how to easily customize the System application in Xperience by Kentico's administration UI to include Git and .NET build metadata.
cms.contentitemcommondata.WebPageMetaTitle: Extending Xperience by Kentico Administration UI Pages #2 - Enhanced System Overview
